pr_title: FacetHandler improvements and additional unit tests

timeline.message:
Adds CardinalityAggregator to properly merge facet table values (#895)

* `CardinalityAggregator` is a `PropogatingCombiner` that is configured
  for the facet table via the `FacetTableConfigHelper`.
* Included unit test for `CardinalityAggregator`.
* Updated `FacetedQueryLogicTest` to properly exercise and validate
  cardinality aggregation. Also updated this test to perform fine
  grained results evaluation.

  for the facet table via the `FacetTableConfigHelper`.
* Included unit test for `CardinalityAggregator`.
* Updated `FacetedQueryLogicTest` to properly exercise and validate
  cardinality aggregation. Also updated this test to perform fine
  grained results evaluation.

* Included unit test for `CardinalityAggregator`.
* Updated `FacetedQueryLogicTest` to properly exercise and validate

Adds CardinalityAggregator to properly merge facet table values (#895)

* `CardinalityAggregator` is a `PropogatingCombiner` that is configured
  for the facet table via the `FacetTableConfigHelper`.
* Included unit test for `CardinalityAggregator`.
* Updated `FacetedQueryLogicTest` to properly exercise and validate
  cardinality aggregation. Also updated this test to perform fine

FacetHandler private constants refactored to protected for subclassing

timeline.bodyText: should this be looking at the Type to decide if this field is tokenized?
timeline.author: FineAndDandy

replies.bodyText: Yes. Not quite ready to tackle this here, yet. This bit is largely unchanged from the inherited codebase.
replies.author: drewfarris

replies.bodyText: Going to punt on this until the next round of work here.
replies.author: drewfarris

timeline.bodyText: should we filter before doing any of the work?
timeline.author: FineAndDandy

replies.bodyText: Yes, I should move the filtering bit to show up prior to the HashTablefunction bit, specifically the call to hashEventFields.
replies.author: drewfarris

replies.bodyText: This has been addressed in the latest version
replies.author: drewfarris

timeline.bodyText: Is creating this right? Down below we create the pivotType/facetType. Why create pivotType/pivotType here?
timeline.author: FineAndDandy

replies.bodyText: I am guessing for cardinality computation?
replies.author: ivakegg

replies.bodyText: yes, this is for the cardinality calculation for the pivot field itself. We retain document counts for the pivot in addition to each of the facets related to that pivot.
replies.author: drewfarris

timeline.bodyText: what happens if we see this event id multiple times?
timeline.author: FineAndDandy

replies.bodyText: specifically does this throw off counts later if we see the same event_id multiple times?
replies.author: FineAndDandy

replies.bodyText: We guarentee (with high probability) that a document has a unique record id which is a combination of the shardid, datatype, and uid.  I think we need to add shardid and datatype to this offer.
replies.author: ivakegg

replies.bodyText:
If we see the same event id multiple times, it does not increase the count (cardinality) for that facet. You can see a good example of that in ApproximateAlgorithmsTest for example.
Good catch @ivakegg - I will look more closely at what event.getId().toString() is returning to ensure it is sufficiently unique. As you point out, I suspect it isn't.
replies.author: drewfarris

replies.bodyText: Ivan's comment has been addressed in the latest version (and yes, he identified a bug - hence the unit test updates)
replies.author: drewfarris

timeline.author: FineAndDandy

timeline.message:
FacetHandler and FacetHandlerTest improvements (#895)

* Adds `CardinalityAggregator` to properly merge facet table values on ingest.
* `CardinalityAggregator` is a `PropogatingCombiner` that is configured
  for the facet table via the `FacetTableConfigHelper`.
* Included unit test for `CardinalityAggregator`.
* Updated `FacetedQueryLogicTest` to properly exercise and validate
  cardinality aggregation. Also updated this test to perform fine
  grained results evaluation.
* `FacetHandler` private constants refactored to protected for subclassing.
* Fixed predicate-based field filtering (to defeat facet generation for a configured set of field names).
* Added configurable predicate for use in subclasses to override TokenPredicate.
* Fixed multi-document unit test to check for missed keys.
* Cleaned up warnings.
* Added test for configurable predicates, this identified an
  issue related to metadata generation which was fixed.
* Fixed incomplete facet hashing and implemented unit test for validation.

FacetHandler and FacetHandlerTest improvements (#895)

* Adds `CardinalityAggregator` to properly merge facet table values on ingest.
* `CardinalityAggregator` is a `PropogatingCombiner` that is configured
  for the facet table via the `FacetTableConfigHelper`.
* Included unit test for `CardinalityAggregator`.
* Updated `FacetedQueryLogicTest` to properly exercise and validate
  cardinality aggregation. Also updated this test to perform fine
  grained results evaluation.
* `FacetHandler` private constants refactored to protected for subclassing.
* Fixed predicate-based field filtering (to defeat facet generation for a configured set of field names).
* Added configurable predicate for use in subclasses to override TokenPredicate.
* Fixed multi-document unit test to check for missed keys.
* Cleaned up warnings.
* Added test for configurable predicates, this identified an
  issue related to metadata generation which was fixed.
* Fixed incomplete facet hashing and implemented unit test for validation.
FacetHandler improvements based on code review (#895)

Updated unit test expectations for FacetedQueryLogicTest (#895)

* Differentiated event ids by datatype, hence higher cardinality.

Updated unit test expectations for FacetedQueryLogicTest (#895)

* Differentiated event ids by datatype, hence higher cardinality.

timeline.bodyText: do we still need this? should the use of id below (shard/datatype/uid) replace this?
timeline.author: FineAndDandy

replies.bodyText: It appears that eventId is needed to find the document if we failed to ingest.  May still be needed, but perhaps as trace and not debug?
replies.author: ivakegg

replies.bodyText: In this particular case, I needed the identifier that was on the original piece of content that was ingested in order to troubleshoot the problem, not the uid that was being generated because I could not tie that back to the original piece of data e.g via the shard table.
replies.author: drewfarris

timeline.message: FacetHandler now uses shard date for all Key timestamps  (#895)
FacetHandler now uses shard date for all Key timestamps  (#895)
FacetHandler now uses shard date for all Key timestamps  (#895)
